title: Electric potential and E field - charges -2Q and Q

content.question: Two small charged spheres, one of charge <math alttext="negative 2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and one of charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>, are located along the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis of an <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-coordinate plane, as shown in the figure. Points <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> and <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> are located along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis as indicated, equidistant from the origin. Which of the following claims is true about both the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component <math alttext="E sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> of the electric field at Point <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> and the electric potential difference <math alttext="delta V sub R S, end sub, equals V sub R, end sub, minus V sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>RS</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is positive and <math alttext="delta V sub R S, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>RS</mtext></msub></math> is negative.

<math alttext="E sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is positive and <math alttext="delta V sub R S, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>RS</mi></msub></math> is zero.

<math alttext="E sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is negative and <math alttext="delta V sub R S, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>RS</mi></msub></math> is negative.

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is positive and <math alttext="delta V sub R S, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>RS</mi></msub></math> is zero.
